author: Staff Reporter
text:
‘Law and order issue should be left to the police ’

The Madras High Court on Thursday refused to stay the permission granted by the police to the Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK) to conduct its state level meeting on the outskirts of Chennai on Saturday. Disposing of a public interest litigation petition seeking to stay the meeting on the apprehension that it could trigger communal tension, the First Bench headed by Chief Justice S K Kaul said the Court would expect the party to “conduct the meeting with all maturity and public responsibility.”

The petitioner claimed that the party and its cadre would not abide by the conditions and cited the violence that occurred in 2013 soon after the party’s State-level meeting.

It is better to prevent the meeting than to face the consequences later, the petitioner said and wanted the court to quash the permission granted by the Deputy Superintendent of Police, Vandalur, Kancheepuram .

The judges, however, said, “We are of the view that in such matters of law and order, the issue should be left to the police authorities.”

It is for the authorities to provide requisite conditions and ensure those conditions are adhered to. In fact, in the present case, it is stated that conditions have already been specified. Hence, the meeting cannot be stayed.

It is better to prevent meeting than to face the consequences later, says the petitioner
title: Court refuses to stay PMK meet
